column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Busy is one thing
column2: but here they check you in so they can txt you and then you are required to go order your pizza(s) (only) at this other hostess station-- which had 3 people taking orders
column3: presumably to speed along your dining experience. Â When they buzz you
column4: they tape a print out to your menu so your server knows about your pizza order and then takes the rest of your order.... I guess 5 stars for efficiency and table-flipping but it didn't make the experience terribly enjoyable or memorable-- unless perhaps waiting for your deep dish is something you'd prefer not to do? Next time
column5: I'm definitely trying some place farther down the list of deep dish pizza places!
